document_name: Geothermal Resources and Natural Mineral Water Law
document_url: https://cdn.climatepolicyradar.org/TUR/2007/TUR-2007-01-01-Geothermal Resources and Natural Mineral Water Law_f1692f37196afcd66d3cb185f11a03fe.pdf
document_description: In order to increase the production and consumption of geothermal energy 10-fold, the Act was passed as a specific act to this renewable source in addition to the Act on Renewable Energy (see flagship legislation).  The Act outlines the procedure, elements and sanctions for issuing transferring and revoking operation licences, auditing the actions of firms while safeguarding resource and the environment. The Act also regulates natural gas that is produced during the process of geothermal production.  The Act sets forth the rules and principles for rightful ownership of the resources, during the exploration and operational periods of the geothermal and natural mineral water resources that are/will be specified along with gases with geothermal origins, their turnover, abandonment, bid tendering and terminating the use of resources and protection and extraction of resources.
